alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 12:00PM MDT until May 28 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of rain falling on a snowpack will continue to accelerate runoff due to snowmelt. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and are expected to remain above bankfull through the weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Along the Yampa River in Moffat County. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including roadways and campgrounds near river banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 AM MDT, rain and snowmelt will continue to elevate water levels, maintaining the risk for minor flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Yampa River - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Moffat County, including Dinosaur National Monument. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
